intro: Erysimum ischnostylum, commonly known as the narrowleaf wallflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright stems and basal leaves that are linear to lanceolate in shape. The plant produces clusters of small, bright yellow flowers with four petals, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Due to its ornamental value and resilience, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
